definition: to do sth for show/to keep up appearances
to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: The company's support of scientific research is just window-dressing.
sentences.chinese: 這個公司支持科學研究只不過是擺樣子給人看的。

sentences.english: I thought it was just for show.
